channel.title: About the Lessons | Survey Research Methods

item.title: Getting Familiar with the Course
item.description:
• Data Camp

Data Camp

While the first module is not due until next Sunday, if you are feeling ambitious, please go ahead and start the first module covering the basics of R on Data Camp. There is a lot on there but please refer to the syllabus for the grading policy regarding those tasks. Just remember, this is not a programming class!

item.title: An Introduction to Surveys
item.description:
• Data Camp
  • Evaluation

Data Camp

The first module is due on Sunday which covers the basics of R on Data Camp. It will cover:

  • Intro to basics
  • Vectors
  • Matrices
  • Factors
  • Data frames
  • Lists

As noted last week, there is a lot on there but please refer to the syllabus for the grading policy regarding those tasks. Just remember, this is not a programming class!

Evaluation

Download a slideshow both in PowerPoint or PDF formats to learn about or review foundational concepts in evaluation.

item.title: Covering the Population and Selecting Who to Survey
item.description:
• Data Camp
  • Sampling

Data Camp

The second exploration in R is a skill track consisting of four modules and is due on Sunday in two weeks. This covers using the tidyverse family in R on Data Camp. It will cover:

  1. Introduction to the Tidyverse
  • Data Wrangling
  • Data visualization
  • Grouping and summarizing
  • Types of visualizations
  1. Working with Data in the Tidyverse
  • Explore your data
  • Tame your data
  • Tidy your data
  • Transform your data

  1. Project: Dr. Semmelweis and the Discovery of Handwashing

  2. Modeling with Data in the Tidyverse

  • Introduction to Modeling
  • Modeling with Basic Regression
  • Modeling with Multiple Regression
  • Model Assessment and Selection

Please get started asap. There is a lot to cover!

Sampling

Download a slideshow both in PowerPoint or PDF formats to review different sampling techniques.

item.title: The Fundamentals of Writing Questions
item.description:
• Data Camp
  • Survey Design

Data Camp

The second exploration in R is a skill track consisting of four modules and is due this Sunday. This covers using the tidyverse family in R on Data Camp. In particular, they are:

  1. Introduction to the Tidyverse
  • Data Wrangling
  • Data visualization
  • Grouping and summarizing
  • Types of visualizations
  1. Working with Data in the Tidyverse
  • Explore your data
  • Tame your data
  • Tidy your data
  • Transform your data

  1. Project: Dr. Semmelweis and the Discovery of Handwashing

  2. Modeling with Data in the Tidyverse

  • Introduction to Modeling
  • Modeling with Basic Regression
  • Modeling with Multiple Regression
  • Model Assessment and Selection
Looking Ahead

If you are wanting to work ahead, the next set of modules that are due in four weeks are listed below:

  1. Modeling with Data in the Tidyverse
  • Communicating with Data in the Tidyverse
  • Categorical Data in the Tidyverse
  1. Exploratory Data Analysis in R
  • Exploring Categorical Data
  • Exploring Numerical Data
  • Numerical Summaries
  • Case study
  1. Modeling with Data in the Tidyverse
  • Introduction to Modeling
  • Modeling with Basic Regression
  • Modeling with Multiple Regression
  • Modeling Assessment and Selection
  1. Dealing with Missing Data in R
  • Why care about missing data?
  • Wrangling and tidying up missing values
  • Testing missing relationships
  • Connecting the dots (Imputation)
  1. Inference for Categorical Data in R
  • Inference for a single parameter
  • Proportions: testing and power
  • Comparing many parameters: independence
  • Comparing many parameters: goodness of fit

Survey Design

Download1 a slideshow both in PowerPoint2 or PDF3 formats to review different item constructions.

  1. These files are pretty big and are hosted on WVU’s Google Drive. You will have to login with your WVU MIX account to access them.↩︎

  2. With my voice. Listen I’m no Morgan Freeman.↩︎

  3. Without audio.↩︎

item.title: How to Write Open- and Closed-Ended Questions
item.description:
• Data Camp

Data Camp

The third exploration in R is a skill track consisting of multiple modules covering modeling and statistical analysis. These can be accessed at Data Camp. In particular, they are:

  1. Modeling with Data in the Tidyverse
  • Communicating with Data in the Tidyverse
  • Categorical Data in the Tidyverse
  1. Exploratory Data Analysis in R
  • Exploring Categorical Data
  • Exploring Numerical Data
  • Numerical Summaries
  • Case study
  1. Modeling with Data in the Tidyverse
  • Introduction to Modeling
  • Modeling with Basic Regression
  • Modeling with Multiple Regression
  • Modeling Assessment and Selection
  1. Dealing with Missing Data in R
  • Why care about missing data?
  • Wrangling and tidying up missing values
  • Testing missing relationships
  • Connecting the dots (Imputation)
  1. Inference for Categorical Data in R
  • Inference for a single parameter
  • Proportions: testing and power
  • Comparing many parameters: independence
  • Comparing many parameters: goodness of fit
